conclusion: To determine the initial distance between Car A and Car B, analyze the velocity-time graph.
Car A starts at 25 m/s and decelerates to 0 m/s; Car B starts at 15 m/s and decelerates to 0 m/s; both stop at 30 seconds.
Calculate the distance each car travels by finding the area under the velocity-time graph.
Car A's distance is calculated as the area of a triangle with base 30 seconds and height 25 m/s, resulting in 375 meters.
Car B's distance is calculated as the area of a triangle with base 30 seconds and height 15 m/s, resulting in 225 meters.
The initial distance between the cars is the difference in distances traveled: 375 meters - 225 meters = 150 meters.
The initial distance between Car A and Car B was 150 meters.
